definition: ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements

sentences.english: Countless revolutionary martyrs have laid down their lives in the interest of the people.
sentences.chinese: 無數革命先烈爲了人民的利益犧牲了他們的生命。

sentences.english: Here has become martyrs Remembrance of the past later pondered the historical sites.
sentences.chinese: 這裏已成爲後人憑弔先烈追憶往事的歷史遺址。

sentences.english: It is the reward of our martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 是我們對先烈的報答，對歷史的擔當。

sentences.english: It falls to our generation to fulfill the great aspirations cherished by countless martyrs in the past.
sentences.chinese: 過去無數先烈的遠大抱負，要我們這一代去實現。

sentences.english: This weekend, this country, is honouring the revolutionaries who became the martyrs of 1916.
sentences.chinese: 這週末，這個國家正在紀念1916年的革命先烈。

sentences.english: Countless revolutionary martyrs have laid down their lives in the interests of the people.
sentences.chinese: 無數革命先烈爲了人民的利益犧牲了他們的生命。

sentences.english: It used to be known as Decoration Day.
sentences.chinese: 它曾經被稱作先烈紀念日。

sentences.english: That our new generation of teenagers how to use the action to cherish the memory of martyrs do.
sentences.chinese: 那我們新一代的少年該怎樣用行動來緬懷先烈呢。

sentences.english: Guangzhou Xianlie Road is a collection of modern memorial cemetery.
sentences.chinese: 廣州先烈路是一條近代紀念性陵園薈萃之路。

sentences.english: So, we are the same person is poor, the revolutionary martyrs orphan.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我倆是一樣的苦命人，都是革命先烈的遺孤。

sentences.english: The students came from a long way off to show their respect for the revolutionary martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 學生們經過長途跋涉來瞻仰革命先烈。

sentences.english: For the country's sake many revolutionary martyrs laid down their lives in the war.
sentences.chinese: 在戰爭中許多革命先烈爲祖國獻出了生命。

sentences.english: For the revolutionary cause many martyrs left life and death out of consideration.
sentences.chinese: 革命先烈爲了革命事業把生死置之度外。

definition: national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
to die in an accident/to die for a just cause
Never forget national humiliation, refers to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
gentleman aspiring to benevolence (idiom); people with lofty ideals
to commemorate/to recall fondly/to think of the past
lit. you can sing or you can cry (idiom); fig. deeply moving/happy and sad/inspiring and tragic
